title: Michael Cohen to tell NY prosecutors 'everything he knows' about Trump's role in hush-money payments
text:
Manhattan District Attorney Cyrus Vance (pictured) has traveled to Otisville prison to speak with Michael Cohen, and now the inmate will be brought to his New York offices for a third meeting

Michael Cohen is expected to be brought from prison to New York City this month, at which point he is likely to tell state prosecutors everything he knows regarding Donald Trump.

Trump's former attorney and fixer, who reported to federal prison at Otisville Federal Correctional Institution in May, could share information that would result in him testifying before a grand jury, a law enforcement official told CNN.

This will be Cohen's third time meeting with prosecutors since reporting to prison, according to the official, and the former Trump-ally is not looking to trade information for a lighter sentence.

In fact, the official notes, Cohen is coming forward voluntarily and without any limitations or preconditions.

The meeting will be held at Manhattan District Attorney Cyrus Vance's office in Lower Manhattan, but it is not clear if Vance will be in attendance. Vance did, however, interview Cohen at Otisville prison last month.

Cohen is serving a three-year sentence at the jail about 70 miles northwest of New York City.

The sentence began in May, months after he plead guilty to multiple crimes, including campaign finance violations related to carrying out hush-money payments to two women – adult entertainer Stormy Daniels and former Playboy model Karen McDougal – who alleged they had affairs with Trump a decade ago.

Cohen is expected to share everything he knows about Trump after spending more than a decade as his attorney and fixer. Here he is shown leaving his apartment to report to prison for his three-year sentence

Cohen plead guilty to campaign finance violations related to carrying out hush-money payments to two women – adult entertainer Stormy Daniels (left) and former Playboy model Karen McDougal (right) – who both alleged they had affairs with Trump a decade ago

Trump has denied having affairs with the women.

Cohen, 53, was Trump's lawyer for more than a decade, but turned against the president in trials when it became clear he was facing jail time.

Although he has direct knowledge of the payments, Cohen admitted he lied to Congress, giving him major credibility issues for any investigators interested in questioning him.

Prosecutors are also going after Trump's tax returns, hoping it will lead to proof of money allocation and potential falsification of any records.

A person familiar with Cohen's time in prison so far says the convicted felon is making friends and enjoying his time away from the spotlight.

Cohen is being held at a minimum security camp at Otisville Federal Correctional Institute meant for criminals who committed white collar crimes.

Since it has a lot of Jewish inmates, due to its proximity to large Jewish populations, a full-time rabbi is employed by the institute and offers kosher meals.
description: Michael Cohen is expected to be brought from prison to New York City this month, at which point he is likely to tell state prosecutors everything he knows regarding Donald Trump.
